questions.question: Due to __________ the track direction one way is not always 180° different to the other direction. This is especially true on tracks running (north-south/east-west).
When measuring track direction, align the protractor with the __________ nearest the __________ of the track.
Bearings on charts are in (°T/°M). In New Zealand we (add/subtract) from chart track direction to get flyable headings.
Isogonals are indicated on the chart by __________.
Which value should you use for variation?
questions.answer: The isogonal which applies to the greatest part of the track.

questions.question: Important information on communications (FISCOM, navaid frequencies), VFR procedures, search and rescue, and emergency procedures can be found in AIPNZ Volumes ___ and ___.
All bearings in AIPNZ Vol 4 are __________, elevations in (AMSL/AGL), dimensions (eg. runway lengths) in __________, distances in __________, visibility in __________ or __________.
questions.answer: Magnetic. AMSL. Metres. Nautical miles. Metres or kilmetres.
